1.label: Temperature Low Threshold
1.description: Use this to change the low temperature alarm threshold. Set the range between -10 and 69 deg C.Note: The user configuration value is a positive decimal integer 0 through 255, but the device interprets the value as 8-bit Two's complement. Examples: -10 in Two's complement is 246 decimal (0xF6). -2 in Two's complement is 254 decimal (xFE) -1 in Two's complement is 255 decimal (xFF) 0 in Two's complement is 0 decimal (0x00). 69 in Two's complement is 69 decimal (0x45). Thus the valid range the user may enter is 0-69 and 246-255.

2.label: Temperature High Threshold
2.description: Use this to change the high temperature alarm threshold. Set the range between -9 and 70 deg C.Note: The user configuration value is a positive decimal integer 0 through 255, but the device interprets the value as 8-bit Two's complement. Examples: -9 in Two's complement is 247 decimal (0xF7). -2 in Two's complement is 254 decimal (xFE) -1 in Two's complement is 255 decimal (xFF) 0 in Two's complement is 0 decimal (0x00). 70 in Two's complement is 70 decimal (0x46). Thus the valid range the user may enter is 0-70 and 247-255.

3.label: Normally Wet vs Normally Dry
3.description: Default is set as a Normally DRY sensor. Use this to switch to Normally WET sensor. The device only accepts one of two possible values: 0 (0x00) - Normally Dry (default). 240 (0xF0) - Normally Wet.

4.label: Water Alarm Association Mode
4.description: Use this to send basic set ON or Basic Set OFF when an alarm is detected. The device only accepts one of two possible values: 0 (0x00) - For sending basic set OFF when alarm detected. 240 (0xF0) - For sending basic Set ON (default) when alarm detected.
